intro: Glochidion macrocarpum var. sumbawanum, commonly known as the Sumbawa glochidion, is a flowering plant native to the Sunda Islands of Indonesia. It is a small to medium-sized tree or shrub that typically grows in lowland rainforests. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical or ovate in shape. Its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences, often with five petals. The fruit is a woody capsule that contains several seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
